intro: Crepidomanes malabaricum, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are often followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, typically in open woodlands or along forest edges. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by livestock and humans.
